title: ## Reading List: Interpretability of NLP Models (Fine-Grained & Causation
This list focuses on articles published up to 2021, emphasizing fine-grained interpretation and causation analysis in NLP
**"Towards a Rigorous Science of Interpretable Machine Learning"**
Lipton: A foundational paper discussing the need for rigorous evaluation of interpretability methods
**"The Mythos of Model Interpretability"**
Critiques common misconceptions about interpretability and emphasizes the importance of context
**"Human-in-the-Loop Interpretability: A Survey"**
by Marco Tulio Ribeiro, Sameer Singh, and Carlos Guestrin: Explores the role of human feedback in improving interpretability
**"Interpretable Machine Learning: A Guide for Making Black Box Models Explainable"** (2018) by Christoph Molnar: A comprehensive guide to various interpretability techniques
**"Attention is not Explanation"**
Challenges the common assumption that attention mechanisms provide meaningful explanations
Explaining the Predictions of Any Classifier"**
note: by Marco Tulio Ribeiro, Sameer Singh, and Carlos Guestrin: Introduces LIME, a method for local explanations.

title: by Ashish Vaswani et al.: Introduces the Transformer architecture, which uses attention mechanisms for fine-grained interpretation
**"Learning to Explain: An Information-Theoretic Perspective on Model Interpretation"**
note: by Amirata Ghorbani, Abubakar Abid, and James Zou: Proposes a framework for learning explanations based on information theory.

title: **"Towards Faithful and Interpretable NLP Models with Local Explanations"**
note: by Marco Tulio Ribeiro, Sameer Singh, and Carlos Guestrin: Extends LIME to NLP tasks.

title: **"Interpretable Machine Learning for Natural Language Processing: A Survey"**
Wallace: A comprehensive survey of interpretability methods in NLP
**"Causal Inference in Machine Learning"**
A foundational book on causal inference in machine learning
**"Causal Inference and Machine Learning: A Survey"**
by Jonas Peters, Dominik Janzing, and Bernhard Schölkopf: A survey of causal inference methods in machine learning
**"Counterfactual Explanations for Machine Learning: A Review"**
by Amirata Ghorbani, Abubakar Abid, and James Zou: Reviews counterfactual explanations for machine learning
**"Causal Inference for Textual Data: A Survey"**
by Yixin Wang, Jingjing Li, and Wei Lu: A survey of causal inference methods for textual data
**"Learning Causal Models from Textual Data"**
by Yixin Wang, Jingjing Li, and Wei Lu: Proposes a method for learning causal models from textual data
**Specific Applications:**
**"Interpretable Machine Learning for Text Classification"**
Wallace: Explores interpretability methods for text classification
**"Towards Interpretable Neural Networks for Text Summarization"**
by Yujia Zhou, Zichao Li, and Wei Lu: Proposes an interpretable neural network for text summarization
**"Interpretable Machine Learning for Sentiment Analysis"**
Wallace: Explores interpretability methods for sentiment analysis
**"Explainable Machine Learning for Natural Language Understanding"**
Wallace: A comprehensive overview of explainable machine learning for natural language understanding
**"Interpretable Machine Learning for Dialogue Systems"**
Wallace: Explores interpretability methods for dialogue systems

**Note:** This list is not exhaustive and there are many other relevant articles published up to 2021. This list provides a starting point for exploring the field of interpretability in NLP, with a focus on fine-grained interpretation and causation analysis
